result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L. Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samuel L. Petersen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samuel L. Petersen was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Samuel L. Petersen was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install [Modifiers: Penalty-Ignition/Immob. Device Tampering], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall be granted 12 days additional jail credit from 12-26-15 to 1-6-16.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Robert Burke via phone on behalf of defendant.  In patient program was found-currently in NOVA program in Oshkosh;  release date is 2-18-16.  Request to change report date of 1-30-16 to 2-18-16.   ADA Troy Cross requests the jail time be changed to start 12-26-15.  Attorney Burke to notify Dane County court that first 12 days in their case are to satisfy this case.  Atty Burke will prepare motion and order.  Court in agreement.
To Change Jail Report Date, with memo from Dane Cty. Alternatives to Incarceration, filed by Atty. Robert Burke

Defendant Samuel L. Petersen in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/elements.  In 14CF46, no contest plea to Ct 2 OAR and Ct 3 Fail to Install IID.  Ct 1 and 4 dismissed.  Ct 2, 20 days jail with  huber commencing 1-30-2016 @ 7 pm.      Fine/costs $243.00 due 60 days or payplan.  Ct 4:  Fine/costs $642.00 due 60 days or payplan.  Civil citation dismissed.  In 14CF474, Ct 1, possess drug paraphernalia, no contest plea, costs $443.00 due 60 days or payplan.  Counts 2/3/4 dismissed.  Court finds not against public interest to dismiss OWI.   Apply cash bond posted.  3 days jail credit in 14CF46.   10:10 am/10:28 am.
